citations.desc: Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries.
citations.narrative:
At the time of the inspection, the Licensee could not locate the documents/records that are required under the AWA
(specifically the written Program of Veterinary Care, Contingency Plan, and the acquisition/disposition records for the
animals). As a result, these required documents/records could not be reviewed during the inspection.
Per this Section. all documents and records that are required to be kept under the Animal Welfare Act (AWA) should be
available at the time of an inspection so the required records can be reviewed to determine the facility's compliance with
the provisions of the AWA. Copies of all documents and records required under the AWA need to be on the premises and
available for review. Correct by 2/16/24.
This inspection and exit briefing were conducted with facility representative.
*END OF REPORT*
n

narrative:
2.126(a)(2) 
   
Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries. 
At the time of the inspection, the Licensee could not locate the documents/records that are required under the AWA 
(specifically the written Program of Veterinary Care, Contingency Plan, and the acquisition/disposition records for the 
animals). As a result, these required documents/records could not be reviewed during the inspection.  
 
Per this Section. all documents and records that are required to be kept under the Animal Welfare Act (AWA) should be 
available at the time of an inspection so the required records can be reviewed to determine the facility's compliance with 
the provisions of the AWA. Copies of all documents and records required under the AWA need to be on the premises and 
available for review. Correct by 2/16/24. 
 
This inspection and exit briefing were conducted with facility representative.  
 
*END OF REPORT*
